resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
assignUser opened a new pull request, #12844:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12844

   With no explicit exit code `exit /b` returns 0. This made the the step never fail.
   The failing test is only for demonstration and will of course be removed prior to merging this PR.

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #12844:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12844#issuecomment-1093149422

   :warning: Ticket **has not been started in JIRA**, please click 'Start Progress'.

   Revision: cde2a453d5606f3984cb32978aebeb043f3d0123
   
   Submitted crossbow builds: [ursacomputing/crossbow @ actions-1833](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/branches/all?query=actions-1833)
   
   |Task|Status|
   |----|------|
   |wheel-windows-cp310-amd64|[![Github Actions](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/workflows/Crossbow/badge.svg?branch=actions-1833-github-wheel-windows-cp310-amd64)](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/actions?query=branch:actions-1833-github-wheel-windows-cp310-amd64)|

assignUser commented on code in PR #12844:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12844#discussion_r846386550


##########
ci/scripts/python_wheel_windows_test.bat:
##########
@@ -35,21 +35,21 @@ set ARROW_TEST_DATA=C:\arrow\testing\data
 set PARQUET_TEST_DATA=C:\arrow\submodules\parquet-testing\data
 
 @REM Install testing dependencies
-pip install -r C:\arrow\python\requirements-wheel-test.txt || exit /B
+pip install -r C:\arrow\python\requirements-wheel-test.txt || exit /B 1
 
 @REM Install the built wheels
-python -m pip install --no-index --find-links=C:\arrow\python\dist\ pyarrow || exit /B
+python -m pip install --no-index --find-links=C:\arrow\python\dist\ pyarrow || exit /B 1 
 
 @REM Test that the modules are importable
-python -c "import pyarrow" || exit /B
-python -c "import pyarrow._hdfs" || exit /B
-python -c "import pyarrow._s3fs" || exit /B
-python -c "import pyarrow.csv" || exit /B
-python -c "import pyarrow.dataset" || exit /B
-python -c "import pyarrow.flight" || exit /B
-python -c "import pyarrow.fs" || exit /B
-python -c "import pyarrow.json" || exit /B
-python -c "import pyarrow.parquet" || exit /B
+python -c "import pyarrow" || exit /B 1
+python -c "import pyarrow._hdfs" || exit /B 1 
+python -c "import pyarrow._s3fs" || exit /B 1
+python -c "import pyarrow.csv" || exit /B 1
+python -c "import pyarrow.dataset" || exit /B 1
+python -c "import pyarrow.flight" || exit /B 1
+python -c "import pyarrow.fs" || exit /B 1
+python -c "import pyarrow.json" || exit /B 1
+python -c "import pyarrow.parquet" || exit /B 1
 
 @REM Execute unittest
-pytest -r s --pyargs pyarrow || exit /B
+pytest -r s --pyargs pyarrow || exit /B 1

Review Comment:
   This would probably also have worked:
   ```suggestion
   pytest -r s --pyargs pyarrow
   ```

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

fields.description:
Here, pytest shows a failure during the "test wheel" step but the entire build is still green:
https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/runs/5572181452?check_suite_focus=true#step:7:554
fields.summary: [CI][Python] "Test wheel" step successful despite test error

comments.body:
We need to properly propagate the error code from the batch script -> docker container -> github actions step.

Currently I'm unable to run windows container locally, could someone take a look?

cc [~ianmcook] [~kou]
I have a windows machine and will take a look.
